column2: wing like bract attached to flower heads
rusty brown hair on vein underside
fruit excessively hairy,wing like bract attached to fruit
Tilia platyphyllos, The "Large Leaved Lime" has bigger leaves but not as broad or tough. Its leaf petioles are shorter and leaf undersides are more hairy.

This tree is distinguished by downward arching branches and hearth shaped leaves. It is often planted on streets but aphids attack the leaves, dripping half digested sap which leaves an unpleasant mess on the pavement.
